intro: Tristerix penduliflorus, commonly known as the hanging flower plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its pendulous inflorescences, which consist of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth surface with a slightly waxy texture. Tristerix penduliflorus is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
